metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1305 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Security constraints defined by annotations of Servlets in Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.4, 8.5.0 to 8.5.27, 8.0.0.RC1 to 8.0.49 and 7.0.0 to 7.0.84 were only applied once a Servlet had been loaded. Because security constraints defined in this way apply to the URL pattern and any URLs below that point, it was possible - depending on the order Servlets were loaded - for some security constraints not to be applied. This could have exposed resources to users who were not authorised to access them.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1305` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.14
libtomcat7-java - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.14
tomcat7 - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.14
tomcat7-admin - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.14
tomcat7-common - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.14
tomcat7-examples - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.14
tomcat7-user - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.14
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.52-1ubuntu0.14').
